page.title: 16Aisby, A dying village?
page.content: The village of Aisby is very isolated. There are about sixteen buildings altogether and only ten of these are houses. The houses, are placed in a circle, and are built mainly from brick, with slate roofs The ages of the houses range from 100 to 170 years old. Only one house has been built recently. Most of the gardens are overgrown. The road leading to the village is in need of repair and the verges and hedgrows need cutting and trimming. Aisby has no amenities, no recreational facilities, no church and no bus service. There is no industry save for farming, mainly barley and wheat and pasture. Aisby seems to be dying as people move out to the towns. { }
